parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural

str2: A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Over, on the other side, beyond. Apparently accusative case of an obsolete derivative of peiro; through, i.e. Across.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To forget, neglect. Middle voice from epi and lanthano; to lose out of mind; by implication, to neglect.
(a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.
